alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 19 at 9:58PM CDT until September 19 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 958 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles north of Little, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Boley... Paden... Bearden... Castle... Mason... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 218. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
